intro: Agalinis besseyana, commonly known as the Bessey's bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the central and southern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as prairies and roadsides. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. It is an annual herb that thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, sunny environments. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
